page.title: 14Farms around Willingham
page.content: There are four main farms in the village area.Each employs no more than 3 people. One farm grows only wheat, the other 3 a combination of{wheat, {barley, potatoes, carrots, peas and {sugar beet.}Very{few animals}are kept except cats for rodent control. Woodhall Farm is 120 acres and has turkeys. Bridge Farm is approximately 234 acres, Glebe farm is 170 acres and Middle Farm 250 acres. Extensive use is made of tractors. Some of the other machinery such as fertiliser spreaders and sprayers is often loaned. All the farms have been in the same family for more than{30 years. Apple orchards, which were once a feature of the area, are disappearing as the trees are grubbed up to make way for more profitable cereal and root crops.
